title: Owen Jones accused of 'bullying' families as BBC guest explodes over 'big state' demand
text:
Owen Jones accused of 'bullying' families as BBC guest explodes over 'big state' demand Owen Jones accused of 'bullying' families as BBC guest explodes over 'big state' demand LEFT-WING activist Owen Jones was torn to shreds during an interview on the BBC as a conservative guest accused the columnist of wanting more state intervention in people's lives. PUBLISHED: 15:15, Tue, Feb 21, 2017 | UPDATED: 16:22, Tue, Feb 21, 2017 
Laura Perrins, co-editor of The Conservative Woman, exploded at Jones as the pair locked heads over gender pay gap in Britain. 
The clash came after a Tory MP Maria Miller, who chairs the women and equalities committee, said it was “deeply disappointing” the government was failing to take aboard the recommendations it made in a report last March. 
Appearing on BBC’s Daily Politics on Tuesday, Perrins, a former barrister took the Guardian journalist to task, as she called the demand for equal pay a “Marxist” idea. 
Raging at Jones, she said: “There are hundreds of thousands of women who combine both work and a career. BBC Laura Perrins exploded at Jones as the pair locked heads over gender pay gap Related articles Owen Jones DESTROYS Piers Morgan during heated Trump clash 
“The Nordic example always comes up but that is actually a very stratified system as well. Women are still paid less than men, they still take up part time jobs and they take up caring roles than the state as taken over. 
“The state essentially pays people to care for them. That is a big state and that is what you want Owen. 
“You want a big state, you want the state meddling in everybody’s decisions, meddling in the family, supplementing everybody’s income. Conservatives believe in a small state.” 
Appearing amused with Perrins’ outburst, Jones replied: “I just want a more equal and just society and I think that women and men shouldn’t have a gap in terms of how they are paid. All we are talking about…” BBC Owen Jones appeared amused with Laura Perrins’ outbursts That is a big state and that is what you want Owen Laura Perrins 
Having none of it, the journalist thundered: “So you want equality of outcome because you’re a big state, you always campaign for the big state.” 
To which the left-wing activist said: “I don’t want women to end up being paid less than men in this country which is why there is a very pragmatic approach, we should have childcare people can afford as well as flexible working.” 
Adding in a challenge to the Conservative guest, Jones added: “You’re for choice, aren’t you?” 
Perrins hit back: “You are for state intervention. You are arguing for state meddling, for bullying of families, bullying mothers in particular.” 
In 2016, the women and equalities committee made 17 recommendations to the Government on how to reduce the gender pay gap. 
It has now emerged the majority of them were rejected and MPs claimed evidence showing women are still paid less than men has been ignored. 
Ms Miller said it was “deeply disappointing” the government was failing to take aboard the recommendations it made in a report last March. 
“We made practical, evidence-based recommendations to address these issues,” she said. 
“They were widely supported by a range of stakeholders including businesses, academics, and unions.” Related articles
